Posts.Content:
Thanks for the reply Merrida,
We are starting to really see (Actually we've seen it all her life) that she is showing major signs of Aspergers Syndrome. I think she's always had it, but the Chemo seems to be intensifying her symptoms. My parents never paid attention to us kids like that growing up, and we always thought she was different, in a quirky sort of way, but after doing research about
 Aspergers, it describes her to a tee! 
I'm going to call her nurse on Monday and discuss what we can do to get her help. I live in South Texas and she is in Michigan so I am not there to rock with her unfortunately! But I am going up there in a few weeks for her last Chemo treatment so we'll see what happens. 
:D
Diagnosed January 31, 2005
Prior Meds: Canasa, Rowasa, Lialda, Apriso, Prednisone, Remicade.. (had neurologicl side effects from Remicade and had to stop)
Current Meds: NOTHING.... 
STATUS: Minor flare...
Posts.Title: Sister Starting Chemo on April 1st

Posts.Content:
Hi everyone
My sister was diagnosed with stage II Breast Cancer and is starting Chemo on April 1st. She is going to be taking the following medications for her chemo and I was wondering if any of you can chime in and let me know if you've had any of these medicines and how they effected you?
She's getting a shot after her chemo called Neulasta to build up her white blood cells.
Her Chemo meds are: Cytoxan, Epirubicin, and Taxotere or Docetaxel. 
She's a little worried about
 side effects and will be getting the treatments every 3 weeks for 8 treatments. 
If any of you can please reply I would appreciate it so I can get this information to her, she doesn't have a computer so I'm trying my best to help her :D
Thank you all so much in advance!
Susie
Posts.Title: Sister Starting Chemo on April 1st

Posts.Content:
Hey everyone, 
I am updating on my sister... She's gotten 4 of her 6 chemo treatments and seems to be handling them fine physically, but mentally she is a complete disaster... She has slipped into such a deep depression... I mean it is major.... 
I am really worried about
 her.. She sits and rocks like someone with autism would act.. she can't make any decisions and just makes these groaning sounds when I talk to her or try to ask her questions... 
She has moved out of her apartment temporarily and is staying with my cousin and her husband who is a physician, but they can't even seem to help her... .
She does go to work and seems to be doing ok there as far as I know, but once she get's home she slips into very isolating behaviors and just rocks and rocks... 
Has anyone else here gone into a depression going through Chemo?? 
I'm afraid she'll end up in the hospital if she doesn't get a grip on things...
Diagnosed January 31, 2005
Prior Meds: Canasa, Rowasa, Lialda, Apriso, Prednisone, Remicade.. (had neurologicl side effects from Remicade and had to stop)
Current Meds: NOTHING.... 
STATUS: Minor flare...
Posts.Title: Sister Starting Chemo on April 1st

Posts.Content:
Hello everyone
 I went to the Dr yesterday for a routine follow up appointment for menopausal symptoms and before starting me on hormone therapy she wanted to re-check a lump she had felt over a year ago and immediately dismissed as a cycst. Well, now she says she's not sure what it is and has me scheduled for a mammo on Thursday morning... UGH.... It feels larger and kind of hard and uneven, and it really hurt when she pushed on it a certain way, I've never felt pain with this lump before... 
 So.... Just wanted to ask for special prayers that this lump is B9 and that I can just go on with things..... but a part of me is scared stiff.. just knowing it's changed is concerning to me... If it does come back as cancer, I'm gonna call her and ask her to NEVER dismiss ANY kind of lump as a cyst... to ALWAYS refer women to get it checked out... 
 So, I'll be clenching my jaw until then.....
Posts.Title: I'm hoping dismissing lump found over a year ago didn't cost me....

Posts.Content:
Just an update:
 I started the HRT and stopped it after 2 weeks.. it made me gain about
 5 pounds and my breasts got so sore and tender I couldn't even hardly take a shower without it hurting.... Plus, I felt just plain bloated and cranky.. I decided that I would rather have hot flashes.. at least my attitude was better and I FELT better... just had a power surge every hour or so... lol.. Now that I stopped, I've lost the weight, boobs don't hurt anymore and I feel more like my old self... I was on estradial .5mg which is supposed to be a very low dose, but it sure effected me~! Maybe I should have given it more time, but I guess I'm a little impatient.. lol. 
 Weird how hormones effect us so much...
Posts.Title: I'm hoping dismissing lump found over a year ago didn't cost me....

Posts.Content:
Hi gma and thank you for your reply :D
 I went in for my mammogram and they did an ultrasound because my breasts are very "dense"... The radiologist that did the ultrasound was being very thorough and said that everything looked good. They did find a little fatty thing, which is probably what I'm feeling, but said nothing to worry about
. I did get a call from my doctors office wanting a follow up breast exam... I'm guessing since I am going to be starting hormone therapy..(dang menopause...UGH) So I have to call the office tomorrow to schedule an appointment. 
 WHEW... I was kinda worried that time... I read your posts about
 your daughter.. I'm so sorry for your loss, she sounded very special.... 
 Hugs, Susie
Posts.Title: I'm hoping dismissing lump found over a year ago didn't cost me....

Posts.Content:
Hi MK
 It's been 1 year since my last Mammo, I get them every October usually since it's bc awareness month and I won't forget that way. Yes, this lump feels like a little pea, not too soft but not too hard either. What worries me a bit is that I can't really move it around like I could all the squishy grape-like B9 cyst lumps I had before... It's hard to explain but I did get a Dr. apppointment for tomorrow at 9:45... I'll keep you posted and thanks for the reply :)
Posts.Title: Question about breast lump

Posts.Content:
Hi everyone...
 Ok.. I went to my doctor appointment today and she examined my breast and found another lump besides the one I found... She said the one she found feels more like fiberous breast tissue, but when I felt it, it felt exactly like a little Bee-Bee would have felt... Then she said the lump that I found felt more like a mass of some sort and that I need to get a mammo.. The part that is really hard for me is that I can't get into the brest imaging center for 3 WEEKS!!!! My apppointment is for November 21st at 9am... I don't know if I can wait that long... my friend who was recently diagnosed with B/C said I should call them back and push for an earlier appointment, and that 3 weeks is a long time to wait.. Now I'm starting to worry a bit.. Not a whole lot, but definately a bit....
Posts.Title: Question about breast lump

Posts.Content:
Hi Michele.. ya, lucky us :)
 Anyhoo, I'm calling them (health insurance co.) today to see what all my options are.. I don't feel that comfy waiting 3 whole weeks... Maybe 1 week, but 3 is a bit long. I have been flaring up with my U/C as well, feeling just plain crappy the last few days and have upped my meds (Rowasa back to nightly) to try and get back into remission....lots of cramping and gas pains... YUCK. Also I have doubled up on my probiotics because I know stress can cause us to get rid of the good bacteria in our intestines as well..l absolutely HATE the waiting part, but time does go by and eventually it will all be over with. (I keep telling myself that anyways)... lol.. 
 Take care and thanks for the replies everyone :)
Posts.Title: Question about breast lump

Posts.Content: I have a bit of good news.. The breast imaging place called me yesterday and they finally got a cancellation. My Mammo is scheduled for tomorrow at 9:40am.... Thank GOD.. the waiting was not as easy as I thought it would be. My hubby is so sweet though, he didn't want me to just sit around and wait, so he took me camping this last weekend and we brought our 2 horses and had a great time! I'll let you all know tomorrow what I find out :)
Posts.Title: Question about breast lump

Posts.Content:
Thanks Lori :)
 I have been through this before, but everytime it happens it still makes me nervous... understandibly of course! LOL... I just pray for good things and keep hoping my luck continues on... It really helps to have this website to post on so you don't feel totally alone.. I mean, my husband is supportive and so is my best friend, but they can't possibly really feel what I feel inside ya know? Only other people who have walked in your shoes can really understand the fear you feel. 
 I found this website when I was diagnosed with Ulcerative Colitis, thank goodness I caught that early and have been able to manage my disease with medicines to the point that I feel pretty good most of the time. Although, I have been flaring up just a bit lately and have increased my meds some, but stress is such a trigger and I'm in a lot of that right now so it's not a big suprise that I am flaring up a little. 
 You know, it's a bit funny, I recently posted here stating how you all deserve applause for the bravery in fighting the fight against b/c..., my son's stepmother and a friend of mine have recently been diagnosed with bc and I have been doing a bit of reading here to see what you guys go through with treatments, etc. I wanted to understand what they were going through a little better and now I'm posting here for myself... this lump is driving me crazy.. lol.. It's sore now cause I keep messing with it, hoping it will just go away... geezz... 
 Well, I won't freak out too much if they want to do more testing right away, I want to get to the bottom of this ASAP and get on with whatever needs to be done, (if anything).. 
 Well, my dr. appointment is tomorrow at 9:45.... I'll keep you posted
 Thanks again for the reply Lori :) It's much appreciated
Posts.Title: Question about breast lump

Posts.Content:
Well, it's been about
 2 weeks and the lump is still there, although it is a bit smaller so maybe it is just breast tissue. I'll have it re-checked in a few weeks as I'm in Montana now and won't be home for some time. Although if I do notice anything frightening, I'll check into having it looked at again up here. Just keeping you all updated :) 
 Thanks for being here :)
Posts.Title: Another lump

Posts.Content: Hey Ladies, I am from the Ulcerative Colitis forum here, but I have posted here on this forum a couple of times with "Close Calls" and you were so kind to me.. I am only here tonight to hopefully help you guys have a good laugh if any of you need one... I just heard this joke and I thought it was so funny, since I have A.D.D. and could totally relate to it! I'm sharing it with you in hopes that you will also find it funny..
Posts.Title: Just to give you all a chuckle

Posts.Content: Hello again ladies... I'm a member and post on the Ulcerative Colitis Board. I posted here a while back when I found a lump in my breast and it fortunately turned out to be B9. Well, I found another lump and went in for the mammo and ultrasound and they told me they couldn't find anything. The lump is still there, even my dr could feel it, so I was told to watch it for a month and to quit drinking caffiene... (OH GOSH, that was hard to hear)... LOL.. I am in my peri-menopause and my breasts were swollen and sore when they did the mammo and ultrasound. Would that have an effect on them not seeing anything? I'm just curious.... and definately keeping my eye on this one...  Thanks for any replies :)
Posts.Title: Another lump
I want to congratulate you all

Posts.Content:
Thanks Jo-Ann
 I did actually tell my friends about
 this website but I don't think they have checked it out. I really wish they would, it is so benificial (sp?) to have support from others who know what you are going through. 
 I myself have had 3 breast lumpectomies, the first one was only a month after I married my husband, I went in for a checkup and the dr did a breast exam and found a lump... She tried to let me feel it but I just couldn't find the spot she had. I went to a specialist a couple of days later and he did an ultrasound on it. The time I really felt scared was when he told me "I can't tell you that it IS bc, but I also can't tell you that it's not..." I had surgery the following week and it turned out to be B9, but they couldn't explain what it was that they took out... seems my body likes to make weird stuff I guess. Since then I've had 2 more, but those were liquid filled cysts and could be sucked out with a needle.. I guess I have fybrocistic breast tissue so I have to really be careful and get my Mammo every year. I do it in October since that's BC awareness month. 
 For the last 3 years I have been lump free, let's hope it stays that way!!
 Anyways, I hope my friends check out this website and I just wanted to add that I can relate a little :)
 Take care everyone
Posts.Title: I want to congratulate you all
